Dear Ms. Koziara:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was assaulted at the facility by another youth who broke
through a wall, window, and door. The staff did not protect youth.
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/4/2024. Youth A reported she and Youth B wanted to fight over
cereal. The incident started in the kitchen. Youth B was calling
Youth A names. Youth A reported Staff 1 restrained Youth B and
had Youth B’s arms behind Youth B’s back. Youth B was moved
from the kitchen to the hallway by Staff 1. Youth A and Youth B
continued screaming back and forth at each other and Youth B
said how she was going to fight her. Youth A reported she yelled
“shut the fuck up, you’re a man, you can’t fight me”. Youth A was
taken downstairs by Staff 2. Staff 5 was blocking the door so
Youth B could not get downstairs. Youth A reported she began to
calm down while downstairs. Youth B was trying to break down
the basement door to get to her and continued yelling names at
Youth A. Youth A reported she began yelling back at Youth B
calling Youth B names. Youth A reported Youth B got through the
door and ran downstairs. Youth B began hitting her. Youth A
reported Staff 1 came down after Youth B and “tackled” Youth B to
get her off Youth A. Staff 2 took Youth A upstairs. Youth B
continued to try to break the door down to get back upstairs and
was yelling through the door at Youth A. Youth A went outside
with Staff 3 and made a phone call. Staff 1 was in the basement
with Youth B. Youth B climbed out the basement window and
Youth A saw Youth B coming from the window and told Staff 3.
Staff 3 attempted to unlock the house door as Youth B was
coming up the porch. Staff 3 was not able to get the door open
2

and Staff 3 was trying to get in between Youth A and Youth B.
Youth B was hitting Youth A and grabbed her hair. Staff 1, Staff 4,
and Staff 5 came out the front door of the house and were
attempting to separate Youth A and Youth B. Staff 5 was able to
get Youth B to let go of her hair. Youth B grabbed onto Youth A’s
sweatshirt and pulled her sweatshirt off her. Youth A reported
staff were able to separate Youth B and her. Youth A went into the
facility with Staff 4. Youth A reported staff did not keep her safe as
staff did not move her away from the house and Youth B was able
to climb through the window to get to her. Youth A reported staff
were not able to stop Youth B from getting to her due to Youth B’s
size. Youth A reported an additional concern regarding a time
when Staff 1 told the youth that he gets to go home at night and
the youth have to stay and Youth A felt this was very disrespectful.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/4/2024. Youth B reported she and Youth A got into a fight due to
Youth A hiding cereal so other youth could not eat it. Youth B
reported she and Youth A were yelling at each other in the kitchen
and staff were holding them back from fighting. Staff 2 and Staff 5
were holding Youth A and Staff 1 was holding her. Youth B
reported Staff 1 held her because she was going to go after Youth
A. Staff 1 took Youth B down the bedroom hallway. Youth B went
into Youth A’s bedroom and broke a mirror. Youth B reported Staff
1 and Staff 4 got her out of Youth A’s bedroom. Youth B reported
she went into the dining room and began kicking the door that
leads to the basement to get to Youth A. Youth B reported she ran
downstairs to try to “attack” Youth A. Youth B reported Staff 1
grabbed her. Staff 1 had Youth B in a hold while Youth A was
taken upstairs with a staff, Youth B did not recall which staff.
Youth B remained in the basement with Staff 1 and Staff 5. Staff
5 was on the stair steps by the door and Staff 1 was sitting on the
couch. Youth B went and sat by the window and told Staff 1 she
was opening the window to get fresh air. Youth B opened the
window and heard Youth A outside on the telephone. Youth B
reported she went “quickly” out the window and went to the front
porch where Youth A was and started to fight her. Youth B
reported she hit Youth A with the telephone. Staff 3 was outside
with Youth A and was trying to stand between Youth A and Youth
B however Youth B reported she was moving Staff 3 out of the
way by pushing Staff 3. Youth B reported she and Youth A were
hitting each other. Staff broke up the fight. Youth B reported it
was “all staff” who broke up the fight. Youth B reported one of the
staff restrained her arms. Youth B was unsure which staff it was
and reported she did not recall how the staff restrained her arms.
Youth A went inside the facility and Youth B remained outside and
3

talked to Staff 1, Staff 5, and Therapist. Youth B did not have any
concerns with staff’s actions or responses to the situation.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/4/2024. Youth C reported Youth A and Youth B recently got into
a fight over cereal. Youth C did not see any of the incident as he
was in the shower when the fighting began and when he came out
of the shower and there was yelling and screaming occurring, he
requested to leave the house due to not feeling safe and being
scared. Youth C reported a staff from Cedar Creek house came
over to South Bluff house and got him. Youth C reported he went
to Cedar Creek house and watched a movie.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/4/2024.
Staff 1 reported he was working when Youth A and Youth B got
into a verbal and physical altercation over cereal. Youth A and
Youth B were in the kitchen and Youth A had hidden some cereal.
Youth B asked Youth A why she was hiding food in the kitchen.
Youth A responded to Youth B “with attitude” that she was hiding
the cereal because all the other youth in the house were eating it.
Youth B told Youth A not to yell at her. Youth A and Youth B
began going back and forth yelling at one another. Staff 1 felt the
situation was escalating quickly and stepped in the middle of
Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1 reported he attempted to escort
Youth B out of the kitchen per Youth B’s safety plan. Staff 1
reported something occurred behind him, unsure what, at which
time Youth A and Youth B “erupted and went full fledge trying to
fight”. Staff 1 attempted to restrain Youth B in a standing PRT and
demonstrated the PRT as hooking his arms over Youth B’s
shoulders and securing her arms behind her back. Staff 1
maintained Youth B in the standing PRT while Youth A was taken
to the basement. Staff 1 reported Youth B was held in the
standing PRT for approximately one minute and released. Youth
B remained escalated and was walking around the dining and
living room and attempted to kick in the door off the dining room
that leads to the basement. Youth B then calmed down. Youth B
reported “being done” and wanting to accept her teaching
corrections per the facilities model. Youth B was told she needed
to clean up the wood/wood dust from the door she was trying to
kick in. Youth B began cleaning up. Staff 1 stood in the door to
continue blocking the door to prevent Youth B from going
downstairs. Staff 1 reported medications needed to be passed
and he felt Youth B was calm at this time. Staff 1 asked Staff 4 to
take over by the door while he went to take care of medications.
Staff 4 was standing in the doorway and Staff 1 went to get the
medication key from staff downstairs. Youth B ran downstairs and
4

Staff 1 heard Staff 4 scream. Staff 1 tried to stop Youth B
however Youth B was already in the basement. Staff 1 jumped
between Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1 reported Youth A and
Youth B were fighting so wildly that they could not be restrained.
Staff, unable to recall who, was standing in front of Youth A. Staff
1 approached Youth B from behind to attempt to restrain her
however was unable to due to her being “so wild”. Youth A was
escorted upstairs, and Youth B remained in the basement with
Staff 1 and Staff 5. Youth B was calming down in the basement
and reported she was hot and asked to open the window. Staff 1
allowed Youth B to open the window as she was “sweaty”. Youth
B was sitting by the window. Staff 1 reported he did not think
anything about Youth B opening the window. Staff 1 sat
downstairs with Youth B and Staff 5 for about ten minutes. Youth
B was sitting by the window, Staff 5 was standing upstairs near
the door as Staff 5 had been blocking the door so Youth B could
not get upstairs to Youth A, and Staff 1 was sitting on the stairs.
Youth B jumped out the window and ran to the porch where Youth
A was with Staff 2 and Staff 3. Staff 1 followed Youth B out the
window. Youth B ran onto the porch and started fighting Youth A.
Staff 1 reported Staff 2, Staff 3, and he broke up the fight and
Youth A was escorted into the house. Youth B remained on the
porch talking to Staff 3 and Therapist as Therapist arrived to the
house at this time. Staff 1 reported the situation de-escalated at
this time. Staff 1 was asked about additional concerns that were
shared in Youth A’s interview. Staff 1 reported there was a time,
unable to recall when, when all the youth in the house were
complaining and cussing at him. Staff 1 told the youth their
cussing does not impact him as he gets to go home at the end of
his shift and explained to the youth that their behaviors determine
when they can go home. Staff 1 reported he feels he tried his
best to keep Youth A and Youth B safe.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/4/2024.
Staff 2 was working when Youth A and Youth B had a verbal and
physical altercation. Youth A came into the kitchen and got out
Rice Krispies that she had hidden in the kitchen. Youth B asked
Youth A what she had hidden in the kitchen. Youth A responded
back to Youth B in a “snarky” tone Rice Krispies because Youth B
was eating all the cereal Youth A liked. Youth B became
escalated and approached Youth A and began yelling in Youth A’s
face. Youth A and Youth B were in the kitchen screaming back
and forth at each other. Staff 2 was present in the kitchen as well
as Staff 1, Staff 4, and Staff 5. Staff 1 got between Youth A and
Youth B telling the youth to stop arguing. Youth A and Youth B
continued yelling and screaming at one another and were
5

attempting to get around Staff 1 to fight. Staff 1 restrained Youth
B by placing his arms under Youth B’s armpits. Staff 1 had Youth
B in the restraint and moved Youth B out of the kitchen down the
hall. Youth A and Youth B continued yelling back and forth at each
other while Youth A remained in the kitchen/dining room area and
Youth B was in the hallway area. Staff 2 took Youth A downstairs
to calm down. Staff 2 sat downstairs with Youth A for ten to fifteen
minutes. Youth A and Youth B continued yelling back and forth at
each other while Youth A was in the basement and Youth B was
upstairs. Staff 2 reported Youth A was angry and Youth A and
Youth B were yelling “nasty” things at each other. Youth B was
kicking at the door upstairs trying to break the door down to get
downstairs to Youth A. Staff 4 was trying to verbally deescalate
Youth B upstairs. Youth B did calm down and the situation settled
down. Staff 1 came downstairs to check on Staff 2 and Youth A.
Youth B ran through the door upstairs that is off the kitchen and
ran into the basement and began running at Youth A and was
screaming. Staff 1 restrained Youth B in the basement when it
occurred as she was with Youth A in the corner of the basement
to prevent Youth B from getting to Youth A. Staff 2 took Youth A
upstairs to keep Youth A away from Youth B. Staff 2 reported
Staff 5 was also in the basement with Staff 2 and Youth A prior to
Staff 1 and Youth B coming into the basement. Staff 2 reported
Staff 5 escorted Youth A upstairs using proper Handle with Care
technique. Staff 5 stood in front of the basement door to block the
door from Youth B being able to come up the stairs to get Youth
A. Staff 1, Staff 4, and Youth B remained in the basement. Staff
3 arrived at the facility to assist. Staff 4 came upstairs after
calming Youth B down in the basement. Staff 1 and Youth B
remained in the basement. Staff 2 and Staff 4 went to Youth A’s
bedroom to clean up as Youth B had broken a mirror in Youth A’s
bedroom. Youth A went outside with Staff 3 and called her
grandma. Staff 2 was cleaning up the glass in Youth A’s bedroom
with Staff 4 when yelling began again, and Youth B went out the
basement window. Staff 2 did not see Youth B go out the
basement window. Staff 2 went to assist and saw Youth A and
Youth B on the porch fighting. Youth B had a grip on Youth A’s
hair and the hood of Youth A’s sweatshirt. Staff 3 was in between
Youth A and Youth B trying to keep them separated. Staff 1 came
out to assist from the basement. Staff 1 secured Youth A by
placing his arms under Youth A’s armpits and was trying to “pull”
Youth A away from Youth B. Youth A was removed from the
porch by Staff 1 and taken into the house. Youth B remained
outside on the porch with Staff 3. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 talked
with Youth B on the porch and was able to calm Youth B down.
Staff 2 reported Youth A went in the house and calmed down.
6

Staff 2 reported there was a safety plan put into place to keep
Youth A and Youth B separated in order to ensure safety after
this.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/4/2024.
Staff 3 was the on-call worker when Youth A and Youth B got into
a physical interaction. Staff 4 sent a text message to Staff 3
stating Youth A and Youth B were verbally arguing and requesting
Staff 3 to come into the facility as Youth B was continuing to
escalate and was attempting to break down the door to get into
the basement where Youth A was. Staff 3 arrived at the facility
within eleven minutes of Staff 4 requesting her to come to the
facility. When Staff 3 arrived not much was occurring. Youth A
was in the living room pacing and Youth B was in the basement.
There was not yelling between Youth A and Youth B. Staff 3 took
Youth A outside on the front porch to call a family member. Staff
2 and Staff 4 were inside the house upstairs and Staff 1 and Staff
5 were downstairs in the house with Youth B. Staff 3 heard a
female staff yell “she went through the window”. Staff 3
immediately attempted to unlock the door to the house however
was not able to do so quick enough. Staff 3 stood in front of
Youth A to protect Youth A from Youth B. Staff 3 reported she is
aware of how strong Youth B is and she felt it was the best way to
protect Youth A. Youth B came onto the porch and was trying to
hit Youth A. Staff 3 was blocking Youth A from Youth B hitting
her. Youth B hit Staff 3 in the face a few times, hitting her on the
right eye, her check, and Staff 3 strained her neck during the
incident. Staff 3 remained in between Youth A and Youth B. Staff
1 and Staff 5 came to assist. Staff 3 reported Youth A and Youth
B were separated within ten to fifteen seconds of the fight starting.
Staff 3 reported it happened very quickly. Staff 5 escort Youth A
into the house. Staff 3 stood in front of Youth B preventing Youth
B from going after Youth A. Staff 3 reported no staff secured
Youth B. Staff 3 did attempt to place Youth B in a restraint during
the altercation however she was unable to physically manage
Youth B as she attempted to loop Youth B’s arms into the
standing one person PRT however it was unsuccessful due to
Youth B’s position on the porch and Staff 3 not being able to get
behind her fully due to the porch railing. Staff 3 released Youth
B’s arms immediately once she was unable to get Youth B into the
PRT. Staff 3 used verbal de-escalation with Youth B outside. Staff
1 and Staff 2 remained outside with Staff 3 and Youth B.
Therapist arrived at the house at this time and talked with Youth
B. Youth A went into her bedroom in the house to calm down and
then was taken out of the house for a car ride to allow Youth A
and Youth B to be separated. Staff 3 reported Youth C was down
7

at main site at the park when she arrived at the facility with staff
from Cedar Creek house and remained with Cedar Creek staff.
Staff 3 reported she feels staff did everything to keep Youth A
safe. Youth A and Youth B are now on safety plans to keep the
youth separated or distance between the youth in the house.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/4/2024.
Staff 4 was at the facility doing observations and, on the job,
coaching with newer staff that were working when Youth A and
Youth B got into a physical altercation. Youth A and Youth B
began arguing in the kitchen over cereal. Staff 1 was in the
kitchen with Youth A and Youth B. Staff 4 reported she did not
see the entire incident however she saw Youth B jump off the
counter and begin arguing with Youth A. Staff 2 and Staff 5 also
came into the kitchen. Staff 1 separated Youth A and Youth B by
escorting Youth B out of the kitchen to the hall and Staff 5
followed. Staff 4 remained with Youth A. Youth A and Youth B
continued yelling back and forth. Staff 4 told Staff 2 and Staff 5 to
take Youth A downstairs. Staff 5 remained upstairs with Staff 1
and Youth B. Youth B went into Youth A’s bedroom and began
breaking Youth A’s belongings. Staff 1 and Staff 4 were
attempting to verbally deescalate Youth B. Staff 1 escorted Youth
B out of Youth A’s bedroom. Youth B was walking around
upstairs and kicked the door to the basement. Youth A and Youth
B were yelling back and forth through the door. Staff 4 got
between Youth B and the door and Youth B stopped kicking.
Youth B was able to make a phone call to her mom as that is one
of her coping skills however Youth B’s mom did not answer the
phone. Youth B calmed down quickly. Youth B said she was
done and ready to work her positive corrections per the Teaching
Family Homes model. Youth B began cleaning up the wood dust
and broken pieces of wood from the door she was kicking. Staff 1
was with Youth B. Staff 1 then went to pass medications as it was
nearing medication time and Staff 4 with assisting Youth B in
cleaning up when Youth B “blew through the door and ran
downstairs.” Staff 4 began following Youth B and yelled for Staff 2
to take Youth A upstairs through the other door. Youth B got
downstairs, and Youth A and Staff 5 were in the corner of the
basement. Staff got between Youth A and Youth B. Staff 5
escorted Youth A upstairs. Staff 1 was on the ground and so was
Youth B. Staff 4 reported she was continuing to try to verbally
deescalate Youth B with Staff 1 and Staff 5. Staff 5 remained at
the top of the steps to prevent Youth B from being able to get
upstairs. Staff 4 went and positioned herself at the other door in
the basement that leads to the upstairs. After talking Youth B
began to calm down. Staff 4 went upstairs to assist Staff 2 with
8

Youth A and to clean up the glass in Youth A’s bedroom. When
Staff 4 got upstairs, Youth A was pacing in the living room. Staff 3
arrived at this time and took Youth A outside to do a telephone call
to family to help Youth A use her coping skills. Staff 4 assisted
with getting Youth C to the park on site to be with other staff. Staff
4 returned to the house and went in to clean up the broken glass
in Youth A’s bedroom when she heard yelling on the porch. Staff 4
went to assist on the porch at which time she saw Youth A and
Youth B fighting and staff, unsure specifically who, in between
Youth A and Youth B. Youth B had a hold of Youth A’s hair. Staff
4 used her thumb to loosen Youth B’s grip on Youth A’s hair.
Youth A and Staff 3 went into the house with Staff 4 and Youth B
remained on the porch with Staff 1. Staff 4 reported she did not
see any staff place either Youth A or Youth B in a restraint on the
porch.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on 3/13/2024. Staff 5
reported she was working at the facility when Youth A and Youth
B got into a verbal argument over cereal resulting in a physical
altercation. Staff 5 was in the office when the situation started and
came of the office and Staff 1 and Staff 2 were present. Staff 1
was in the kitchen asking them to stop arguing and Staff 2 was
asking Youth A to leave the kitchen. Youth A started to call Youth
B some transphobic names and that caused things to escalate.
Youth B ran after Youth A. Staff 2 took Youth A downstairs, and
Staff 1 was getting “a hold” of Youth B by placing Youth B in a
single person PRT. Staff 5 opened the door to let Staff 2 and
Youth A downstairs. Staff 5 did not go downstairs. Youth B went
into Youth A’s bedroom and was destroying it as she had picked
up Youth A’s chair and used it to break the vanity mirror. Staff 5
assisted Staff 1 with Youth B and asked Youth B to leave Youth
A’s bedroom and Youth B walked out of the bedroom. Staff 5 went
downstairs with Staff 2 and Youth A. Staff 1 and Staff 4 remained
upstairs with Youth B. Staff 2 and Staff 5 sat downstairs with
Youth A verbally deescalating Youth A by using empathy and
reality statements to help Youth A calm down. Youth A began
calming down and the yelling from Youth B upstairs had stopped.
Staff 1 came downstairs to get medications as it was time for
medications to be passed. Staff 5 heard Staff 4 yell for Staff 1 and
suddenly Youth B was in basement running toward Youth A. Staff
5 and Staff 2 immediately stood in front of Youth A to block Youth
B from getting to Youth A. Staff 5 was facing Youth A and did
direct Youth A to go upstairs. Staff 5 reported Youth A was yelling
at Youth B and was getting in Youth B’s face. Staff 5 remained in
front of Youth A to keep Youth A and Youth B separated. Staff 5
placed Youth A in an escort and walked her upstairs. Staff 5
9

described the escort as she had her right arm hooked on Youth
A’s right arm in the position that is used for a one person PRT
however she did not complete the PRT hold as she just had one
arm secured behind Youth A’s back and Youth A walked willingly
with her upstairs. Staff 5 did not see anything that was going on
with Youth B behind her as she was focused on getting Youth A
upstairs. Staff 5 and Youth A got up to the top of the stairs and
Staff 2 took Youth A upstairs and Staff 5 remained at the top of
the stairs with the door closed behind her to keep Youth B from
attempting to come up the stairs for Youth A’s safety. Right after
Youth A went up, Youth B ran up the stairs and was trying to get
past her. Staff 5 continued to stand there holding the door handle
and using her body to block the door handle. Staff 5 was using
empathy and reality statements to try to get Youth B to calm
down. Youth B began to calm down and walked back down the
stairs. Staff 5 stood at the top of the stairs and Staff 1 was
downstairs with Youth B. Staff 5 stood at the top of the stairs for
approximately fifteen minutes. Youth B was walking around the
basement and Staff 1 was standing in the basement watching
Youth B. Youth B said she was hot and opened the window. Staff
5 did not see Youth B open the window due to being at the top of
the stairs. Staff 1 was standing at the bottom of the stairs, not on
the stairs. When Youth B opened the window the next thing Staff
5 knew was Staff 1 looked at her and said Youth B went out the
window. Staff 5 ran into the upstairs and ran outside. Staff 3 had
been outside with Youth A on the phone. Staff 5 immediately put
herself between Youth A and Youth B as they were yelling at each
other again. Staff 3 was also between Youth A and Youth B.
Staff 2 and Staff 4 were inside but came outside. Staff 1 came
outside through the basement window following Youth B. Staff 5
reported Youth A and Youth B were yelling at each other, the
telephone was on the ground, and Youth B had a hold of Youth
A’s sweatshirt, unsure if Youth B had Youth A’s hair. Staff 5 was
between trying to separate Youth A and Youth B using verbal
directions and taking Youth B’s hand off Youth A’s sweatshirt just
by lifting Youth B’s hand off. Youth A went inside the facility. Staff
5 remained outside with Youth B and Staff 1 standing in front of
Youth B blocking the door to the facility. Staff 1 and Staff 5
continued talking to Youth B using empathy and reality
statements. Staff 5 did not believe anyone tried to restrain either
Youth A or Youth B on the porch. Staff 5 did not believe Youth A
was escorted into the facility, she described Staff 2 leading Youth
A into the house however was unable to say how as she was
focused on Youth B and facing away. Staff 5 did not believe
Youth A was hit at any time during the incident. Staff 5 did not
think anything could have been differently to keep Youth A safe.
10

Staff 5 did not have any concerns with anything her coworkers did
or how they responded that day, Staff 5 felt staff did the best they
could.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 2/28/2024 and
reported they had no further information.
Video Reviewed
Video footage of 2/25/2024 in the kitchen/dining room area
was reviewed on 3/4/2024. Youth A and Youth B are in the
kitchen with Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 4, and Staff 5. Youth A and
Youth B are yelling at each other. Youth B was sitting on the
counter and jumped off the counter and approached Youth A.
Staff 1 put his arms around Youth B with his right arm appearing
to be near Youth B’s waist and his left arm over Youth B’s left
shoulder. Staff 1 pulled Youth B back from Youth A and turned her
toward the kitchen counter. Once Youth B is facing the kitchen
counter, Staff 1 repositioned his hands/arms by sliding his arms
through Youth B’s arms holding under Youth B’s armpits. Staff 2,
Staff 4, and Staff 5 are in the kitchen area with Youth A behind
them. Staff 1 held Youth B under the armpits with her arms back
and walked her out of the kitchen toward the hallway. Youth B
attempted to turn her body to go back toward Youth A and Staff 1
held her in the hold and continued walking her down the hallway
as both Youth A and Youth B continued screaming at one another.
Youth A can be heard yelling “you’re a man, you’re a man, you’re
a man.” Staff 2, Staff 4, and Staff 5 stand in front of Youth A. Staff
2, Staff 4, Staff 5, and Youth A moved from the kitchen to the
living room area and Staff 4 and Staff 5 went down the hallway
toward Staff 1 and Youth B. Staff 2 unlocked the basement door
and Youth A began to walk toward the basement door. Staff 4
approached the basement door with Staff 2 and Youth A tried to
walk back toward the hallway. Staff 2 and Staff 4 used their
bodies to keep Youth A from moving toward Youth B down the
hallway. Staff 2 and Youth A go into the basement and Staff 4
closed the door and walked toward the hallway.
Video footage of 2/25/2024 in the kitchen/dining room/living
room area was reviewed on 3/4/2024. Staff 1 and Staff 4 are in
the dining and living room area with Youth B. Staff 1 stood in front
of the door that leads to the basement off the dining room while
Youth B is tried to get through the door. Staff 4 is stood behind
Youth B. Youth B turned and walked toward the door in the living
room that leads to the basement. Staff 4 remained in front of
Youth B and blocked the door with her body. Youth B turned
around and walked back to the door that leads to the basement in
11

the dining room. Staff 1 remained in front of Youth B and blocked
the door with his body. Youth B turned around again and ran to
the door leading to the basement in the living room. Youth B is
able to get in front of Staff 4. Staff 4 put her arm out in front of
